intro: Lasianthus obliquinervis subsp. novoguineensis, commonly known as the New Guinea lasianthus, is a species of flowering plant in the family Acanthaceae. It is characterized by its slender, erect stem and opposite, ovate to elliptic leaves with slightly serrated margins. The leaves are usually dark green and have a smooth upper surface with a hairy underside. It produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically pale blue or purple in color. This subspecies is native to the tropical regions of New Guinea and is often found in moist, shaded habitats.
